Effective Blog Commenting - How to do it Correctly

If you comment on the right blogs you can go all sorts of places in terms of marketing, traffic and backlinks. The internet has millions of blogs that get updated all the time and all you have to do is find a well related blog and start your commenting engines. If you look though, you'll see that most of the blogs have some sort of system set up in which your comments must first be approved before they actually get published. So in order to increase the chances of your comments being accepted, there are a few things that you need to keep in mind. Keep reading to learn three things that you can do to help you find more success with your blog commenting efforts.

Limit to One Comment Per Day, Per Blog: It is important to remember, especially when you start out in blog commenting, is that you need to limit yourself to one comment for each blog you target every day. Do not go overboard when you comment, even if you've got something relevant to say. You do this so that the blogger will not think that you're just another spammer trying to steal his or her readers' attention. However, it's 100% different when you are taking part in a conversation with the blog owner or other people reading the comments section--that is a time when it is totally normal to leave multiple comments.

Target Blogs That You're Comfortable With: When it comes down to it, you need to try to just comment on those blogs that you feel most comfortable with. There are going to be times when you'll find a blog super interesting even though it isn't in a relevant category and might be in a totally unrelated niche. But if this blog is something that you're comfortable commenting on and the subject is of your interest, you should go for it. The point here is that if you want to make sure your comments are useful and genuine, you should have a genuine interest in the post. So as an example, if you're commenting on the http://www.creditrestoreusa.com weblog, you should see to it that the comment is relevant.

Compliment the Blogger: Before you get into the meat of your comment, make certain to pay the author of the blog a compliment so that he or she will be more likely to bite on your comment. The compliment needs to be honest and it should have something to do with the post on which you are commenting. This will bring in a feel good factor and make the blogger feel that you are real and someone who's just being honest. The very worst thing you can do, however, is leap immediately toward flattery because it makes you look like your only goal is to impress the blog owner for empty reasons. Find a balance between good words and comment content.

Quality is of the utmost importance in blog commenting, never forget that.
